title: Why do 18th century English people used to wear hats? - Quora

response.answer_text: In what sense do you mean “keep hats?” If you mean “wear hats,” they wore them for the same reasons that any other article of clothing is worn: partly for protection and partly for fashion. It was generally believed before the later 20th century or so that to go bare-headed outside was unhealthy, bringing colds in the head or possibly even heatstroke. In eighteenth century Europe and America there were also social customs associated with the wearing of the hat that were regarded as very important, e. g., the taking off of the hat to show respect or regard for another, such as a superior or a lady, which would be impossible, of course, without a hat to perform.
